item.title: Isaiah 4
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 4

1 At that time, seven widows will grab hold of one man and say, “We’ll provide our own food and clothes. Just let us take your name so we won’t be old maids!"

2 But at that time, the LORD’s branch will be beautiful and glorious. What the ground produces will be the pride and joy of Israel’s survivors. 3The remnant in Zion and Jerusalem will be holy, everybody that’s in his record books for living there. 4When the LORD has washed the grime off of Zion’s inhabitants and cleaned up the bloodstains in Jerusalem by the spirit of judgment and burning, 5then he’ll create over Mount Zion and its assemblies a cloud of smoke during the day, a bright blazing fire at night, and a canopy above the glory. 6It’ll be shade from daytime heat and shelter from storms and rain.

item.title: Isaiah 7
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 7

1 At the time of Ahaz son of Jotham son of Uzziah, king of Judah, Rezin, king of Syria, and Pekah son of Remaliah, king of Israel, attacked Jerusalem but couldn’t take it. 2When the news reached Judah’s royal court that Syria was in league with Ephraim, their hearts sank, and they shook like trees in the wind.

3 The LORD said to Isaiah, “Take your son Shear-jashub [A remnant will return] and go meet Ahaz at the end of the aqueduct that supplies the Upper Pool on the road to the Fuller’s Field. 4-6Tell him not to worry about Rezin and Remaliah’s son. He doesn’t need to be afraid or fainthearted over the fierce anger of those two smoldering sticks. True, they’re plotting to attack Judah and install Tabeel as king there. 7-9But that’s not going to happen. Syria’s headquarters is in Damascus, led by Rezin; Ephraim’s headquarters is in Samaria, led by Remaliah. Just trust me, and I’ll make you outlast them. In 65 years, Ephraim will be shattered, no longer a people."

item.title: Isaiah 8
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 8

1 Then the LORD told me, “Take a large tablet and etch on it in standard letters ‘Maher-shalal-hash-baz’ [quick to the plunder, swift to the spoil].” 2I got reputable men to witness it: Uriah the priest and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah. 3So I had relations with my wife the prophetess, and she had a son. The LORD told me, “Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz, 4because before he knows how to say ‘daddy’ or ‘mommy,’ the king of Assyria will ‘carry away the wealth’ in Damascus and ’the spoil’ in Samaria."

Isaiah Chapter 20

1 Sargon, king of Assyria, sent his general to attack Ashdod. 2That year the LORD spoke through Isaiah son of Amoz, “Take the burlap off your waist and remove your sandals.” So he went around naked and barefoot. 3The LORD said, “My servant Isaiah has gone naked and barefoot for three years as an omen to Egypt and Nubia. 4The king of Assyria will lead captives away from there, young and old, naked and barefoot with their butts showing, to Egypt’s humiliation. 5People will be disgraced and disappointed by Nubia their hope and Egypt their pride. 6The people along the coast will say, ‘Look at what’s happened to them! How can we escape who fled there for protection from the king of Assyria?!’"

item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 24

They’re burned; there aren’t many left.

item.title: Isaiah 36
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 36

1 In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked the fortified towns in Judah and took them. 2He sent the Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem with a large army. They took position by the aqueduct to the upper pool on the road to the Fuller’s Field. 3Eliakim son of Hilkiah, the palace administrator; Shebna, the court secretary; and Joah son of Asaph, the royal historian, went out to meet them.

item.title: Isaiah 37
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 37

1 When Hezekiah heard it, he tore his clothes, put on burlap, and went to the Temple. 2He sent Eliakim, Shebna, and the senior priests to the prophet Isaiah. 3They went to him and said, “Hezekiah says, ‘This is a distressing, discouraging, dejecting day. Babies have come due, but there’s no strength to deliver them. 4Maybe the LORD your God has heard the Rabshakeh that the king of Assyria sent to mock the living God. Maybe he’ll reprove him for it. Pray for the remnant that’s left.’” [5]

item.title: Isaiah 38
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 38

1 Around that time, Hezekiah got deathly ill, and Isaiah came to tell him, “The LORD says to set your house in order; you’re going to die."

2 Hezekiah turned to the wall and prayed, 3"LORD, please remember how I’ve followed you honestly with all my heart and done what you consider good.” He cried bitterly.

4 Then a message from the LORD came to Isaiah: 5"Go back and tell Hezekiah that the LORD God of your ancestor David says, ‘I’ve heard your prayer and seen your tears. I’ll give you 15 more years to live 6and deliver you and this city from the king of Assyria. 7This is the sign that I’ll do what I’ve said: 8I’ll make the shadow on Ahaz’s stairway go back up 10 steps.’"

item.title: Isaiah 39

Isaiah Chapter 39

There wasn’t anything in his palace or kingdom that he didn’t show them.

9 You’ve gone to Molech with olive oil

10 You’ve worn yourselves out by your long search,

12 I’ll tell everybody about your so-called good deeds,

item.title: Isaiah 58
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 58

1 Shout; don’t hold back;

2 They look to me daily and seem to delight to know my ways,

3 Then they wonder, ‘Why have we fasted, and you haven’t noticed?

4 You fast only to win disputes and fist fights—

5 Is that the kind of fast I had in mind for humbling yourselves?

6 Isn’t this the kind of fast I had in mind:

7 Isn’t it sharing your food with the hungry,

item.title: Isaiah 59
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 59

1 It’s not that the LORD’s hand is not too weak to save

2 It’s your iniquities that have separated you from him;

3 You’ve defiled your hands with blood,

4 None of you brings just suits or argues cases honestly;

5 You hatch viper eggs and weave spider webs;

6 Your webs can’t become clothes;

7 You hurry to do harm,

8 You don’t know any road that leads to peace;

item.title: Isaiah 60
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 60

1 Arise, shine; your light has come;

2 Darkness will cover the earth;

3 Nations will come to your light,

5 Then your eyes will be radiant;

6 Caravans of camels will cover you,

7 The flocks of Kedar will gather to you;

8 Who are these that fly like a cloud,

9 The distant lands will learn to trust in me;

11 Your gates will stay open day and night

item.title: Isaiah 61
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 61

1 The Spirit of the Lord GOD is on me;

4 Then they’ll rebuild the ancient ruins,

5 Foreigners will pasture your flocks,

6 But you’ll be the LORD’s priests;

7 Instead of humiliation you’ll have a double portion;

9 Then the nations will honor your offspring worldwide;

10 I’m really happy in the LORD;

11 As the ground produces seeds

item.title: Isaiah 62
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 62

1 For Zion’s sake I’ll speak to God;

3 You’ll be a beautiful crown in his hand,

4 You won’t be called Abandoned [Azubah] anymore

5 Like a young man marries a virgin,

6 I’ve stationed watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem,

8 He has sworn by his right hand and strong arm,

9 But the ones that put the grain in the granary

10 Go out through the gates;

item.title: Isaiah 63
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 63

1 Who is this that’s coming from Edom

2 Why are your clothes stained red

4 I’ve had a day for payback on my mind;

5 But I looked, amazed

6 I tramped down nations in my fury

7 I’ll recount the praises and tell about Yahveh’s enduring love

8 He said, “They’re my people,

9 In all their adversity he felt their suffering;

10 But they did rebel and grieve his Holy Spirit;

item.title: Isaiah 64
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 64

1 Oh that you’d open the sky and come down

3 When you did awesome things we didn’t expect,

4 No one has ever heard of a God like you

5 You visit those who enjoy doing good,

6 We’ve all become unclean;

7 No one calls on you or reaches out to you

8 But now, LORD, you’re our Father;

9 Don’t be angry beyond measure;

item.title: Isaiah 65
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 65

1 I let people look for me who weren’t asking about me;

2 All day long I spread out my hands to a rebellious nation

6 I’ve written it out in front of me:

9 I’ll preserve a remnant from Jacob and Judah

10 Sharon will be a pasture for flocks;

13 So the Lord GOD says,

15 The name you leave behind will be a curse to my chosen ones,

item.title: Isaiah 66
item.description:
Isaiah Chapter 66

1 The LORD says,

2 I made all this;

4 I’ll carry out their punishments

5 Listen to this message from the LORD,

6 The uproar in the city and the Temple

8 Who ever heard of such a thing?

9 Would I bring to term and not deliver?

10 Be joyful over Jerusalem, you that love her;

12 This is what the LORD says,

13 I’ll comfort you like a mother does;
